issue.title: §[locale.cons] Ambiguous argument in Throws for locale+name+category constructor

blockquote.pre: locale(const locale& other, const char* std_name, category);

blockquote.p: Throws: runtime_error if the argument is not valid, or is null.

discussion.p: There being three arguments, the statement is rather problematic. It looks like a copy/paste from
The conclusion, assuming that "the argument" is also std_name in the problem case, seems to be that the statement should be changed to read:

blockquote.p: Throws: runtime_error if std_name is not valid, or is null.

discussion.p:
However there is implementation divergence over whether or not values for the category argument not explicitly described as valid by result in runtime_error.
libc++ does not throw. libstdc++ does.
Code:
Set priority to 3 after reflector poll.
The proposed resolution of would resolve this too.
The implementation divergence is not a problem. p2 makes invalid category values undefined, so silently ignoring them or throwing exceptions are both valid.

p.ins: Preconditions: The category argument is a valid value .

blockquote.p: Throws: runtime_error if the argumentstd_name is not valid, or is null.
